docs.abstract: The coming sensor innovations, I.B.M. says, are vital ingredients in what is called cognitive computing. The idea is that in the future computers will be increasingly able to sense, adapt and learn, in their way.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: In his article about an Elderhostel trip to Las Vegas, ''A Disbeliever on the Strip'' (Dec. 28), Alan S. Oser complained about a large gentleman hogging space at a blackjack table. He complained sanctimoniously that he, himself, didn't like to gamble, and he spent $200 skipping classes to fly to the Grand Canyon. He complained about front-row seats at a show, and complained about losing 25 cents in a slot machine. Mr. Oser trudged and tramped, stared blankly at garish imitations, and skipped many lectures. I've seen a few guys like him on some of my 35 Elderhostel trips. I wished they had stayed at home instead of ruining my pleasure in learning something new. BOB RIORDAN Dallas
docs.abstract: Bob Riordan letter responds to Alan S Oser's December 28 travel article about Elderhostel trip to Las Vegas; photo

docs.lead_paragraph: The world’s biggest semiconductor company is scrambling for a place in sensors, wireless networking and autonomous vehicles, as computing spreads to nearly every machine.
docs.abstract: Intel chief exec Brian Krzanich is expected to discuss company’s shift towards smartphone, wireless networking and other emerging technologies at its upcoming Developer Forum in San Francisco; shrinking personal computer market has been hurting profits for world’s largest manufacturer of semiconductors.
docs.snippet: The world’s biggest semiconductor company is scrambling for a place in sensors, wireless networking and autonomous vehicles, as computing spreads to nearly every machine....

headline.print_headline: Intel’s New Mission: Find Fresh Uses for Its Famous Paranoia

docs.lead_paragraph: To develop a computer smart enough to beat champions on “Jeopardy,” independent scientists had to learn to work together in unfamiliar ways, the team leader says.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study hosted by Stanford University will examine impacts on society, including on the economy, war and crime.
